generate interrupt when maintenance operation is complete
generate interrupt when maintenance operation is complete
do maintenance operation in L2 Cache.Note: Hardware ensures that the maintenance operations are done in L1 first and then in L2

bitenum.description: perform maintenance operation selected by the maintenance bits

bitfield.description: do maintenance operation in L1 Cache 2

bitenum.description: perform maintenance operation selected by the maintenance bits

bitfield.description: do maintenance operation in L1 Cache1

bitenum.description: perform maintenance operation selected by the maintenance bits

bitfield.description: generate interrupt to cpu when maintenance operation initiated by CPU is complete
generate interrupt when maintenance operation is complete
invalidate lines in region defined by maintenance start/end addresses
evict dirty lines in region defined by maintenance start/end addresses
unlock region defined by maintenance start/end addresses

preload region defined by maintenance start/end addresses
Start address of maintenance operations, resets to 0x0000 when finished
End address of maintenance operations, resets to 0x0000 when finished
Privilege bit. Once this bit is set, only global flush, debugger, or hardware reset can clear.

bitenum.description: CPU can only access maintenance, and DMA cannot access MMU at all.

bitfield.description: MMU lock. Once this bit is set only a global flush, debugger, or hardware reset can clear.

bitenum.description: CPU can only access maintenance, and DMA cannot access the MMU.
